document.title: Wisconsin's Model Academic Standards for Art and Design Education

4234E2B0DFE80131E81268A86D17958E.description: Exhibit imagination by interpreting situations from more than one point of view

42348260DFE80131E81168A86D17958E.description: Understand that artists develop a personal style that reflects who they are

423433B0DFE80131E81068A86D17958E.description: Explore nature and designs by artists as sources for new ideas for their artwork

4233E230DFE80131E80F68A86D17958E.description: Understand that art is created by people and changes our time and culture

423383A0DFE80131E80E68A86D17958E.description: Explore the role that personal traits, such as independent thinking, courage, integrity, insight, dedication, and patience, play in creating quality art and design

423334A0DFE80131E80D68A86D17958E.description: Begin to develop a base of knowledge and skills from which to create new ideas

4232DEA0DFE80131E80C68A86D17958E.description: Use their knowledge, intuition, and personal experiences to develop ideas for artwork

42328890DFE80131E80B68A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will use their imaginations and creativity to develop multiple solutions to problems, expand their minds, and create ideas for original works of art and design.

4231F520DFE80131E80968A86D17958E.description: Know about some of the similarities and differences of world cultures by studying their fine arts: music, dance, theatre, literature, and architecture

4231AF50DFE80131E80868A86D17958E.description: Know art includes activities, such as museum curation, historic preservation, collecting, and writing about art and design

42316890DFE80131E80768A86D17958E.description: Use a variety of tools, such as words, numbers, sounds, movements, images, objects, emotions, technology, and spaces, to help understand and communicate about the visual world

42311900DFE80131E80668A86D17958E.description: Use what they are learning about life, nature, the physical world, and people to create art

4230D2A0DFE80131E80568A86D17958E.description: Invent new ways to communicate ideas and solutions to problems in art

42308B10DFE80131E80468A86D17958E.description: Connect their knowledge and skills in art to other areas, such as the humanities, sciences, social studies, and technology

42303B90DFE80131E80368A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will make connections among the arts, other disciplines, other cultures, and the world of work.

422F13F0DFE80131E80068A86D17958E.description: Talk about art in basic terms

422EB4C0DFE80131E7FF68A86D17958E.description: Understand the difference between original artworks, reproductions, and copies

422E72A0DFE80131E7FE68A86D17958E.description: Know that different cultures have different concepts of beauty

422E2F50DFE80131E7FD68A86D17958E.description: Begin to understand and apply the role of art criticism and aesthetic knowledge in art and design

422DEAA0DFE80131E7FC68A86D17958E.description: Begin learning the value of art as a basic part of being human

422D9E80DFE80131E7FB68A86D17958E.description: Begin to understand their own ideas about the purposes and meanings of art

422D5190DFE80131E7FA68A86D17958E.description: Learn that philosophers think about art

422D0F20DFE80131E7F968A86D17958E.description: Learn that different cultures think about art differently

422CCBA0DFE80131E7F868A86D17958E.description: Understand that the choice of materials and techniques influences the expressive quality of art

422C8690DFE80131E7F768A86D17958E.description: Explore the purposes and functions of art

422C3EC0DFE80131E7F668A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will reflect upon the nature of art and design and meaning in art and culture.

422B8F20DFE80131E7F468A86D17958E.description: Work alone and with others to develop visual ideas and objects

422B3A40DFE80131E7F368A86D17958E.description: Realize that creating or looking at art can bring out different feelings

422AE850DFE80131E7F268A86D17958E.description: Understand that art is made by people from different times, places, and cultures

422A93C0DFE80131E7F168A86D17958E.description: Recognize their own feelings when they look at work of art

422A4DF0DFE80131E7F068A86D17958E.description: Talk or write about feelings in a work of art

422A0130DFE80131E7EF68A86D17958E.description: Make art that shows how they sometimes feel

4229A870DFE80131E7EE68A86D17958E.description: Use art to understand how they feel

42295AC0DFE80131E7ED68A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will use their senses and emotions through art and design to develop their minds and to improve social relationships.

42288B00DFE80131E7EA68A86D17958E.description: Know how artists make photographs and films

42284170DFE80131E7E968A86D17958E.description: Be able to read simple maps, charts, and plans

4227F690DFE80131E7E868A86D17958E.description: Create three-dimensional forms with paper, clay, and other materials

4227B440DFE80131E7E768A86D17958E.description: Show differences among colors, shapes, textures, and other qualities of objects in their artwork

42277150DFE80131E7E668A86D17958E.description: Use drawing to examine objects closely

42272CC0DFE80131E7E568A86D17958E.description: Study the patterns and color in nature

4226E390DFE80131E7E468A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will develop perception, visual discrimination, and media literacy skills to become visually educated people.

42263840DFE80131E7E268A86D17958E.description: Know how to create works of art that have meanings

4225CA70DFE80131E7E168A86D17958E.description: Talk and write about the meanings of artworks and design

4224D910DFE80131E7DE68A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will interpret visual experiences, such as artwork, designed objects, architecture, movies, television, and multimedia images, using a range of subject matter, symbols, and ideas.

4223ED80DFE80131E7DB68A86D17958E.description: Learn to make changes in media production

42239FD0DFE80131E7DA68A86D17958E.description: Learn how media productions are made

42231070DFE80131E7D868A86D17958E.description: Know that production techniques affect viewers' perceptions

4222C0F0DFE80131E7D768A86D17958E.description: Know that there are stereotypes in visual media

42227D20DFE80131E7D668A86D17958E.description: Know that advertisements, news, and entertainment programs contain visual messages

42223810DFE80131E7D568A86D17958E.description: Know that art techniques are used in mass media

4221F270DFE80131E7D468A86D17958E.description: Learn that art includes mass media, such as magazines, television, computers, and films

4221ADC0DFE80131E7D368A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will understand the role of, and be able to use, computers, video, and other technological tools and equipment.

42210990DFE80131E7D168A86D17958E.description: Use the visual arts to express ideas that cannot be expressed by words alone

4220BA30DFE80131E7D068A86D17958E.description: Communicate basic ideas by producing visual communication forms useful in everyday life, such as sketches, diagrams, graphs, plans, and models

42206290DFE80131E7CF68A86D17958E.description: Communicate basic ideas by producing popular images and objects, such as folk art, traditional arts and crafts, popular arts, mass media, and consumer products

42201900DFE80131E7CE68A86D17958E.description: Communicate basic ideas by producing design art forms, such as graphic design, product design, architecture, landscape, and media arts, such as film, photography, and multimedia

421FD520DFE80131E7CD68A86D17958E.description: Communicate basic ideas by producing studio art forms, such as drawings, paintings, prints, sculpture, jewelry, fibers, and ceramics

421F8A80DFE80131E7CC68A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will produce quality images and objects that effectively communicate and express ideas using varied media, techniques, and processes.

421EB270DFE80131E7C968A86D17958E.description: Use problem-solving strategies that promote fluency, flexibility, elaboration, and originality

421E6720DFE80131E7C868A86D17958E.description: Learn basic language used in art

421E0340DFE80131E7C768A86D17958E.description: Learn about basic concepts in art, such as "form follows function," "less is more," balance, symmetry, and originality

421DADD0DFE80131E7C668A86D17958E.description: Know that the environment influences the look and use of art, architecture, and design

421D5E70DFE80131E7C568A86D17958E.description: Know about artists and designers, such as architects, furniture designers, critics, preservationists, museum curators, and gallery owners, in their community

421D1820DFE80131E7C468A86D17958E.description: Know basic information, such as the history, public art, and unique architecture, of their own cultural community

421CC670DFE80131E7C368A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will apply their knowledge of people, places, ideas, and language of art and design to their daily lives.

421C2D00DFE80131E7C168A86D17958E.description: Develop personal responsibility for their learning and creative processes

421BD560DFE80131E7C068A86D17958E.description: Be aware of their creative processes to better understand their work

421B7960DFE80131E7BF68A86D17958E.description: Explore the natural characteristics of materials and their possibilities and limitations

421B29E0DFE80131E7BE68A86D17958E.description: Develop basic skills to produce quality art

421AE5A0DFE80131E7BD68A86D17958E.description: Use sketching to develop ideas for their artwork

421AA020DFE80131E7BC68A86D17958E.description: Look at nature and works of art as visual resources

421A10F0DFE80131E7BA68A86D17958E.description: Know how the design of art changes its meaning

421975E0DFE80131E7B868A86D17958E.description: Explore the elements and principles of design

421931E0DFE80131E7B768A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will design and produce quality original images and objects, such as paintings, sculptures, designed objects, photographs, graphic designs, videos, and computer images.

42183860DFE80131E7B468A86D17958E.description: Learn that art historians, cultural anthropologists, and philosophers of art contribute to an understanding of art and design

4217E9A0DFE80131E7B368A86D17958E.description: Begin to understand environmental and aesthetic issues related to the design of packaging, industrial products, and cities

4217A170DFE80131E7B268A86D17958E.description: Know basic ways to describe, analyze, interpret, and judge art images and objects from various cultures, artists, and designers

42175C80DFE80131E7B168A86D17958E.description: Understand that their choices in art are shaped by their own culture and society

42171A50DFE80131E7B068A86D17958E.description: Know that art is influenced by artists, designers, and cultures

4216D680DFE80131E7AF68A86D17958E.description: Know that works of art and designed objects relate to specific cultures, times, and places

42168BF0DFE80131E7AE68A86D17958E.description: Recognize that form, function, meaning, and expressive qualities of art and design change from culture to culture and artist to artist

42163B20DFE80131E7AD68A86D17958E.description: Understand that artists and cultures throughout history have used art to communicate ideas and to develop functions, structures, and designs

4215F4D0DFE80131E7AC68A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will understand the value and significance of the visual arts, media and design in relation to history, citizenship, the environment, and social development.

4215B060DFE80131E7AB68A86D17958E.description: Art and Design History, Citizenship, and Environment

42156B20DFE80131E7AA68A86D17958E.description: Know that art is a basic way of thinking and communicating about the world

421522F0DFE80131E7A968A86D17958E.description: Know that art is one of the greatest achievements of human beings

4214CCC0DFE80131E7A868A86D17958E.description: Learn about styles of art from various times

421476E0DFE80131E7A768A86D17958E.description: Learn about basic styles of art from their own and other parts of the world

42142650DFE80131E7A668A86D17958E.description: Learn basic vocabulary related to their study of art

4213D030DFE80131E7A568A86D17958E.description: Develop a basic mental storehouse of images

42137680DFE80131E7A468A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will know and remember information and ideas about the art and design around them and throughout the world.
